edu.du.penrose.systems.util
Class XSLTransformerDUextension

java.lang.Object
  edu.du.penrose.systems.util.XSLTransformerDUextension

public class XSLTransformerDUextension
extends java.lang.Object

This is a copy of org.jdom.transform.XSLTransformer, with the exception of the new constructor allowing you too specify the XSLT processor.

Author:
Chet Rebman
See Also:
"org.jdom.transform.XSLTransformer", XSLTransformerDUextension(File, SAXTransformerFactory)

XSLTransformerDUextension

public XSLTransformerDUextension(java.io.File stylesheet,
                                 javax.xml.transform.sax.SAXTransformerFactory saxTransFormFactory)
                          throws org.jdom.transform.XSLTransformException

This will create a new XSLTransformerDUextension by reading the stylesheet from the specified SAXTransformerFactory File using specified .

This is a DU extension.

Parameters:
stylesheet - File from which the stylesheet is read.
saxTransFormFactory - SAXTransformerFactory the XSLT transformer to be used.
Throws:
org.jdom.transform.XSLTransformException - when an IOException, format error, or something else prevents the stylesheet from being compiled

Parameters:
stylesheet - Document containing the stylesheet.
Throws:
org.jdom.transform.XSLTransformException - when the supplied Document is not syntactically correct XSLT

setFactory

public void setFactory(org.jdom.JDOMFactory factory)
Sets a custom JDOMFactory to use when building the transformation result. Use a custom factory to build the tree with your own subclasses of the JDOM classes.

Parameters:
factory - the custom JDOMFactory to use or null to use the default JDOM classes.
See Also:
getFactory()

getFactory

public org.jdom.JDOMFactory getFactory()
Returns the custom JDOMFactory used to build the transformation result.

Returns:
the custom JDOMFactory used to build the transformation result or null if the default JDOM classes are being used.
See Also:
setFactory(org.jdom.JDOMFactory)
